intro: Oxytropis campestris var. tiroliensis, commonly known as the Alpine burclover, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Oxytropis campestris var. tiroliensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
